newsitem.title: FRANCE: France faces national newspaper black-out.
newsitem.headline: France faces national newspaper black-out.

text.p: A 24-hour strike call by book trade unions threatens to keep all French national newspapers off the country's newsstands on Tuesday, a statement by the daily Liberation said on Monday.

A committee of Paris book trade unions said it was calling the stoppage in support of workers at depots in Paris suburbs employed by the Nouvelles Messageries de la Presse Parisienne (NMPP), France's largest press distribution organisation.

Talks between the NMPP and workers, which include the CGT union, have deadlocked after three weeks of labour conflict over planned changes in working practice, the unions' statement said. They want negotiations to reopen on the reforms.

The NMPP said the planned changes were aimed at securing the future of the present distribution system, which needs a more effective and cheaper system of operations. "Without that, the system itself risks being put into question one day," the NMPP said in a statement.
The NMPP said the changes will not lead to sackings or change of status but are aimed at changing working hours for 200 workers.
